page.title: 07FARMING IN FOUR LANES.
page.content: Dairy farming is easily the most common type of farming in the district. The Fresian cow being the popular choice. Some intensive management of grassland is done but the majority is cut for hay and silage. Beef cattle is the next frequent the Hereford-cross is reared and sent to cattle markets in Redruth and Camborne. Milk is collected by tanker and is taken to St. Erth creamery 10 miles away. Crops are mainly hay, cereals are hardly grown at all neither are root crops. Very few sheep are kept a few on the Eastern side of the area near Stithians Reservoir.
